sticky_note: Revision History #R7 should say that the LCD was revised not the article.

Note: In the “Explanation of Revision:” in Revision History Number R4 it was indicated that the addition of ICD-10-CM codes was based on a reconsideration request in error. This addition of the ICD-10-CM codes was based on an external correspondence.
This LC?D is scheduled to retire 12/31/2025 and we will not be making any changes in the interim.
The LCD has been revised during Notice to add “affecting the respiratory system” to the limitation for neuromuscular disease.

Comments are only open for this addition “Coverage criteria expanded to include blood-based biomarker colorectal cancer screening test, positive, in compliance with revised NCD 210.3, Colorectal Cancer Screening Tests.”

Please note clarification to the Issues Description third paragraph below:
On 3/20/2025, a revision was made throughout LCD to change verbiage referring to gender. This update was made to the version of this LCD updated on 04/25/2025 and published on the Medicare Coverage Database on 05/01/2025.

Please note clarification to the Issues Description third paragraph below:
On 3/20/2025, a revision was made throughout LCD to change verbiage referring to gender. This update was made to the version of this LCD updated on 04/25/2025 and published on the Medicare Coverage Database on 05/01/2025.
The effective date for this policy has been moved to 01/01/2026.

Only the following clarifying language is open for official comment: "Intraoperative TEE is reimbursable to a qualified cardiologist, cardiac surgeon, anesthesiologist, or other qualified physician, but only when performed as a significant, separately identifiable diagnostic test with a formal written report, and not for monitoring purposes."
Only the use of serum and urine mass spectrometry (MS) in monoclonal gammopathies (MGs) is open for official comment.

Only the following revisions are open for official comment:
1.The use of the word dominant in the coverage indications has been removed from the following: Moderate to severe postural or intention tremor of the hand (defined by a score of =2 on the Clinical Rating Scale for Tremor (CRST)
2. The added indications for Bilateral Thalamotomy for Essential Tremor.
3. The added limitations for Bilateral thalamotomy for Parkinson’s Disease and Unilateral pallidotomy for Parkinson’s Disease.
4. The change of skull density ratio from <0.45 to <0.40.

Only the updated genomic biomarkers and their clinical utility in acute myelogenous leukemia (AML), myelodysplastic syndromes (MDS), and myeloproliferative neoplasms (MPN) are open for official comment.
Only the off- label use of bevacizumab in hereditary hemorrhagic telangiectasia (HHT) with arteriovenous malformations (AVMs) causing gastrointestinal bleeding is open for official comment.
The Requestor Information has been updated to include a Reconsideration Request letter.
The Requestor Information has been updated to include a Reconsideration Request letter.
Only the specific genes (CYP2C19, CYP2C9 and CYP2D6) that have been transitioned to the new Pharmacogenomic Testing LCD are open for official comment.
Only the removal of "voided volume greater than 125cc" from the Indications of Coverage is open for official comment.
Only the uses of Rituximab for ANCA- Associated Vasculitis (AAV), IgG4-related pancreatitis, and Susac Syndrome are open for official comment.
Only the off-label use of Intravenous Immune Globulin (IVIG) for Susac Syndrome is open for official comment.
